content.description: On the left hand side of the wall, just right of the tree, find a line of beautiful holds. Follow these right for a move or two, then launch up to a good jug.
content.location: Second line from the left tree.

content.description: Climb large devious pockets to ever decreasing holds, and a somewhat committing topout. Kind of tricky. Just left of tree.
content.protection: Okay, there is a big tree just right, pads

content.description: This left to right traverse is an excellent way to start off the day, and you can make it as hard as you want! If you stop at the tree it will feel like V2. If you can squeek by the dabby tree and top out into the ramp, it will feel like V3/4.
content.protection: A few well placed pads is fine.

content.description: Leashless and Free is probably the best line on the wall.  Start off of a great rail, then move up and right past a couple toothy holds. A series of perfect holds awaits. About as good as V0 gets.

The right to left traverse! Start way right at a black side pull pocket, and a tooth like hold for the left. Stay low and work over to a good undercling. Pop up to the huecos, and continue moving left. The path of least resistance incorporates two undercling pockets which you don't really use on The Rez Dog. Top out just right of tree on A Dog Knows.
content.protection: One or two pads over the crux is good.
content.location: Start under bulge on far right side of the wall, past the tree.

content.description: An awkward test of your limestone skills. Climb the weakness, right of The Whining Warmup.
A juggy start leads to a distant vertical finger lock. Another great line for the grade.
A Dog's Life is a classic series of jugs, and big moves in between them. Starts on the perfect hueco. How sweet it is.
On the far left side of the wall, just right of the tree, climb jugs to fluted holds, and finally a protruding nose feature to top out. Really good for the grade.
content.location: Left side of the wall, first problem right of tree.

pathTokens: Land of High Bouldering AKA The Ridge

content.description:
​

Whining Dog Wall- Google Earth

The Whining Dog Wall is perhaps the best, moderate bouldering wall in all of Flagstaff. This beautiful black and blue, perfectly bulging wall is lined with classic problems and perfect holds. First developed in the early 1990's, this wall is as good as it gets for the grades.

 This wall is formed in such a way as to provide very classic traverse problems, as well as numerous variation problems.
